original_content:
message_id: 177ee78096091f58
subject   : Subject: ONE WAY OF SALVATION (3-2-210
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 1 Mar 2021 09:46:20 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*We maintain that a man is justified by faith *

*apart from **observing the law. *(Ro. 3:28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

“Since we have been justified through faith,

we have peace with God through our Lord

Jesus Christ” (Ro. 5:1) We can in no way

say that we are justified (fully or in part) by

good works. That would be worksrighteous-

ness which has no place in Christian beliefs.

*How thankful we can be* *that salvation,*

*forgiveness, **and peace with God do not *

*rest on* *what we are able **to do but are *

*entirely the works* *of Christ.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Let us give thanks to God for having spoken *

*clearly **through the prophets and apostles in *

*matters of Faith.*
original_reflection_text:
“Since we have been justified through faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ” (Romans 5:1) We can in no way say that we are justified (fully or in part) by good works. That would be worksrighteous ness which has no place in Christian beliefs.
How thankful we can be that salvation, forgiveness, and peace with God do not rest on what we are able to do but are entirely the works of Christ.
original_verse_text: We maintain that a man is justified by faith  apart from observing the law.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, knowing that our salvation is not earned through our own works, but is a gift of grace through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. We thank You for the peace and justification we have received, not by our own merit, but through the perfect work of our Lord. Help us to walk in this truth, ever mindful that our relationship with You is secured by Christ's sacrifice, and not by our own efforts. May we live in the freedom and assurance of Your love. Amen.
reflection: “Since we have been justified through faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ” (Romans 5:1). We can in no way say that we are justified (fully or in part) by good works. That would be works-righteousness, which has no place in Christian beliefs. How thankful we can be that salvation, forgiveness, and peace with God do not rest on what we are able to do but are entirely the work of Christ.
subject: One Way of Salvation
verse_text: We maintain that a man is justified by faith  apart from observing the law.

original_content:
message_id: 177f5cbadb12a7e0
subject   : Subject: THE FOLLY OF SIN, THE WISDOM OF FAITH
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 2 Mar 2021 19:55:02 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(3-3-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Even the animals—the donkeys and ox—*

*know their **owner and appreciate their *

*care, but not my people **Israel. No matter *

*what I do for them they still do not **under-*

*stand. *(Isa. 1:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

How do we explain that human beings endowed with a mind and everything

that goes with it—reason, judgement, intelligence, memory—sometimes sink

below base animal instinct? Why should people so deprive themselves of good

sense as to stager from one sin to another,

becoming so lost that they must ask others

to show them the way home (not only their earthly home but their heavenly
one as well?

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Holy Spirit to grant you the wisdom and **knowledge to be a true
disciple of Jesus. *
original_reflection_text:
How do we explain that human beings endowed with a mind and everything that goes with it-reason, judgment, intelligence, memory-sometimes sink below base animal instinct? Why should people so deprive themselves of good sense as to stagger from one sin to another, becoming so lost that they must ask others
to show them the way home (not only their earthly home but their heavenly one as well?
original_subject: THE FOLLY OF SIN, THE WISDOM OF FAITH
original_verse_text:
Even the animals-the donkeys and ox- know their owner and appreciate their  care, but not my people Israel.
No matter  what I do for them they still do not under-  stand.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the profound truth that even the most gifted among us can stray from Your ways. Like the ox that knows its owner and the donkey its master's crib, we too often fail to recognize Your sovereignty and the abundant blessings You have bestowed upon us. Forgive us for the times we have become lost in the darkness of our own desires, and grant us the wisdom and discernment to seek Your guidance, that we may find our way back to the path of righteousness. Lord, restore our minds and our souls, that we may glorify You in all that we do. Amen.
reflection: How do we explain that human beings endowed with a mind and everything that goes with it—reason, judgment, intelligence, memory—sometimes sink below base animal instinct? Why should people so deprive themselves of good sense as to stagger from one sin to another, becoming so lost that they must ask others to show them the way home (not only their earthly home but their heavenly one as well)?
subject: The Folly of Sin, the Wisdom of Faith
verse_text:
Even the animals-the donkeys and ox- know their owner and appreciate their  care, but not my people Israel.
No matter  what I do for them they still do not under-  stand.

date      : Wed, 3 Mar 2021 17:39:01 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verse:*

*I will tell everyone of your justice and goodness,*

*and I will praise You all day long. *(Ps. 36:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In contrast to evil people and their wicked plots

that end in failure God is faithful, righteous, and

just. His love is as vast as the heavens; His faith-

fulness reaches beyond the clouds; His righteous-

ness is as solid as mighty mountains, and His

judgments are as full of wisdom as the oceans

are with water. We need not fear evil people be-

cause we know God loves us, judges evil, and

will care for us throughout eternity.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask for the Holy Spirit’s help, so you can con-*

*tinue to honor and praise the Triune God.*
original_reflection_text:
In contrast to evil people and their wicked plots
that end in failure God is faithful, righteous, and
just.
His love is as vast as the heavens; His faith foulness reaches beyond the clouds; His righteous ness is as solid as mighty mountains, and His
judgments are as full of wisdom as the oceans
are with water. We need not fear evil people be cause we know God loves us, judges evil, and
will care for us throughout eternity.
original_subject: THE VAST NESS OF GOD'S LOVE
original_verse_text: I will tell everyone of your justice and goodness, and I will praise You all day long.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your unfailing love and unwavering faithfulness. Your righteousness stands firm like the mighty mountains, and Your judgments are as deep as the vast oceans. We take refuge in Your steadfast care, knowing that You will judge the wicked and protect Your children throughout eternity. May we ever dwell in the abundance of Your house and drink from the river of Your delights. Amen.
reflection: In contrast to evil people and their wicked plots that end in failure, God is faithful, righteous, and just. His love is as vast as the heavens; His faithfulness reaches beyond the clouds; His righteousness is as solid as mighty mountains, and His judgments are as full of wisdom as the oceans are with water. We need not fear evil people because we know God loves us, judges evil, and will care for us throughout eternity.
subject: The Vast Bess of God's Love
verse_text: I will tell everyone of your justice and goodness, and I will praise You all day long.

original_content:
message_id: 177ff824662d6d85
subject   : Subject: PREPARING A CORRECT PATH (3-5-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 4 Mar 2021 17:11:04 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Teach your children to choose the right *

*path, and **when they are older, they will *

*remain upon it. *(Pro. 22:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In the process of helping our children

“choose the right path,” we must discern differing paths for each child. It
is natural

to want to bring up all our children alike

or train them the same way. This verse im-

plies that parents should discern the individ-

uality and special strengths that God has

given each one. While we should not con-

done or excuse self-will, each child has

natural inclinations that *parents* can develop. By talking to teachers,
other parents, and grandparents, we can better discern and develop the
individual capabilities of each child.

*Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks for your Christian education *

*and **pray to the Lord Jesus to nurture you *

*in the **faith. *
original_reflection_text:
In the process of helping our children “choose the right path,” we must discern differing paths for each child. It is natural to want to bring up all our children alike or train them the same way. This verse im plies that parents should discern the individ duality and special strengths that God has
given each one. While we should not con done or excuse self-will, each child has natural inclinations that parents can develop. By talking to teachers, other parents, and grandparents, we can better discern and develop the individual capabilities of each child.
original_verse_text: Teach your children to choose the right  path, and when they are older, they will  remain upon it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance as we strive to raise our children in the way they should go. Help us to discern the unique path and strengths You have given to each child, that we may nurture their individuality and develop their God-given potential. Grant us the patience and insight to walk alongside them, guiding them in Your ways, and not provoking them to anger. May our homes be filled with Your love, grace, and the transformative power of Your Word. Amen.
reflection: In the process of helping our children “choose the right path,” we must discern differing paths for each child. It is natural to want to bring up all our children alike or train them the same way. This verse implies that parents should discern the individuality and special strengths that God has given each one. While we should not condone or excuse self-will, each child has natural inclinations that parents can develop. By talking to teachers, other parents, and grandparents, we can better discern and develop the individual capabilities of each child.
subject: Preparing a Correct Path
verse_text: Teach your children to choose the right  path, and when they are older, they will  remain upon it.

original_content:
message_id: 17809e1951d5780b
subject   : Subject: POWER OF THE WORD AND FAITH (3-7-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 6 Mar 2021 17:31:22 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus was driving out a demon that was *

*mute. *(Lk. 11:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is important that we take these words

of Jesus to heart. *“Blessed rather are *

*those who hear the Word of God* a*nd*

*obey it” *(Lk. 11:28). Yes, blessed are

*all* who believe in Jesus Christ, for He

loves us so much that He laid down His

life for our salvation. When Jesus is our abiding Friend, *there **is no
room* for

demons in our hearts and minds. What

a blessed deliverance! Our Lord has set

us free from sin and Satin!

*Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks to Jesus for redeeming you, asking **His help so you **can
remain free!*
original_reflection_text:
It is important that we take these words of Jesus to heart. “Blessed rather are those who hear the Word of God and obey it” (Luke 11:28). Yes, blessed are all who believe in Jesus Christ, for He loves us so much that He laid down His life for our salvation. When Jesus is our abiding Friend, there is no room for demons in our hearts and minds. What
a blessed deliverance! Our Lord has set us free from sin and Satin!
original_subject: POWER OF THE WORD AND FAITH
original_verse_text: Jesus was driving out a demon that was  mute.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the gift of Your Word and the salvation found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to hear and obey Your voice, that we may be blessed and freed from the bondage of sin and the power of the enemy. May our hearts be a dwelling place for Your Holy Spirit, that we may walk in the light of Your truth and live as Your redeemed children. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: It is important that we take these words of Jesus to heart. “Blessed rather are those who hear the Word of God and obey it” (Luke 11:28). Yes, blessed are all who believe in Jesus Christ, for He loves us so much that He laid down His life for our salvation. When Jesus is our abiding Friend, there is no room for demons in our hearts and minds. What a blessed deliverance! Our Lord has set us free from sin and Satin!
subject: Power of the Word and Faith
verse_text: Jesus was driving out a demon that was  mute.

original_content:
message_id: 17813f0e6c036194
subject   : Today's Subject: GOD'S WORD--A POWER IN TODAY'S WORLD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 8 Mar 2021 16:24:18 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(3-9-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*I am not ashamed of the Gospel, because *

*it is the **power of God for the salvation of everyone who **believes. *(Ro.
1:16)

*Today’s Reflection: *

The apostle did not give up, but He confid-ently declared the power of the
Gospel in bringing salvation to all who believe. The Word of God points to
Jesus Christ as having obediently fulfilled all righteousness for us and as
having suffered death on the cross for our redemption. Now we are willing
and able to live to the glory of God, always in confor-mity to His Holy
will.

*Pastor Sather*

*Pray that God, for Jesus sake, will through the **Gospel give you the
strength to live as becomes His people.*
original_reflection_text: The apostle did not give up, but He confidently declared the power of the Gospel in bringing salvation to all who believe. The Word of God points to Jesus Christ as having obediently fulfilled all righteousness for us and as having suffered death on the cross for our redemption. Now we are willing and able to live to the glory of God, always in conformity to His Holy will.
original_subject: GOD'S WORD--A POWER IN TODAY'S WORLD
original_verse_text: I am not ashamed of the Gospel, because  it is the power of God for the salvation of everyone who believes.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the power of the Gospel, which brings salvation to all who believe in Your Son, Jesus Christ. We are grateful that through His obedience and sacrifice, we are made righteous and able to live for Your glory. Help us to remain steadfast in our faith, confident in the redemption that is ours through Christ. May we always strive to conform our lives to Your holy will. Amen.
reflection: The apostle did not give up, but he confidently declared the power of the Gospel in bringing salvation to all who believe. The Word of God points to Jesus Christ as having obediently fulfilled all righteousness for us and as having suffered death on the cross for our redemption. Now we are willing and able to live to the glory of God, always in conformity to his holy will.
subject: God's Word--A Power in Today's World
verse_text: I am not ashamed of the Gospel, because  it is the power of God for the salvation of everyone who believes.

original_content:
message_id: 178191dafccfb37b
subject   : Subject: GETTING TO KNOW JESUS BETTER (3-10-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 9 Mar 2021 16:31:19 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*O hope of Israel, its Savior in time of distress, why **are you like a
stranger in the land, like a traveler **who stays only a night? *(Jer. 14:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What we have here is a paradox, a yes-and-no situation. Yes, many in
Jerusalem recognized Jesus, *but *they really didn’t know Him. To some He
was an imposter, a trouble maker,

or a mere teacher and would-be-healer. To

a relative few He was the Mes-siah and Son

of God revealed. For a relative few, John wrote, *“He was in the world,
and though *

*the world was made through Him, the world did not recognize Him” *(Jn.
1:10).

*He remained a stranger and a Traveler *

*just passing through.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Beg the Holy Spirit to reveal Christ Jesus *

*more clearly to you as you study God’s Word. *
original_reflection_text:
What we have here is a paradox, a yes-and-no situation. Yes, many in Jerusalem recognized Jesus, but they really didn’t know Him. To some He was an imposer, a trouble maker, or a mere teacher and would-be-healer.
To a relative few He was the Mes-siah and Son of God revealed. For a relative few, John wrote, “He was in the world, and though the world was made through Him, the world did not recognize Him” (John 1:10). He remained a stranger and a Traveler just passing through.
original_verse_text: O hope of Israel, its Savior in time of distress, why are you like a stranger in the land, like a traveler who stays only a night?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing the paradox of Your Son's coming. Though He was in the world, the world did not know Him. Many saw Him, but few truly recognized Him as the Messiah and the Son of God. Lord, open our eyes to see Your Son clearly, that we may receive Him and become Your children. May we not be like those who saw Him as a stranger or a mere teacher, but may we embrace Him as our Savior and Lord. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: What we have here is a paradox, a yes-and-no situation. Yes, many in Jerusalem recognized Jesus, but they really didn't know Him. To some, He was an imposter, a troublemaker, or a mere teacher and would-be healer. To a relative few, He was the Messiah and Son of God revealed. For a relative few, John wrote, “He was in the world, and though the world was made through Him, the world did not recognize Him” (John 1:10). He remained a stranger and a traveler just passing through.
subject: Getting to Know Jesus Better
verse_text: O hope of Israel, its Savior in time of distress, why are you like a stranger in the land, like a traveler who stays only a night?

original_content:
message_id: 1781e4c6af3df6c8
subject   : Subject: HOW PERMANENT IS WHAT YOU BUILD
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 10 Mar 2021 16:40:28 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(3:11-21)—read Mt. 7:24-29

*Today’s Verse:*

*The winds blew and beat against that*

*house; yet **it did not fall. *(Mt. 7:25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Christian homes, however humble, will

stand long after mansions built on greed

have blown away by the winds of change

and decay. This is a good time to ask our-selves: In what kind home do we
live? Is

it, thanks to Christ’s presence, a place where we can prepare for the
Father’s house of

many rooms?

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us give thanks to God for homes through-out **the world that are based
on the words of Jesus **and on His redeeming work.*
original_reflection_text:
Christian homes, however humble, will stand long after mansions built on greed have blown away by the winds of change and decay. This is a good time to ask ourselves: In what kind home do we live? Is
it, thanks to Christ’s presence, a place where we can prepare for the Father’s house of many rooms?
original_subject: HOW PERMANENT IS WHAT YOU BUILD
original_verse_text: The winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the promise of your eternal home, where you have prepared a place for us. May our earthly dwellings, however modest, be built upon the firm foundation of your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to abide in Him, that our lives may be a testament to your love and grace, withstanding the storms of this world. Guide us as we prepare our hearts to dwell with you forever. Amen.
reflection: Christian homes, however humble, will stand long after mansions built on greed have blown away by the winds of change and decay. This is a good time to ask ourselves: In what kind of home do we live? Is it, thanks to Christ's presence, a place where we can prepare for the Father's house of many rooms?
subject: How Permanent is What You Build
verse_text: The winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall.

original_content:
message_id: 1782372ce62b136b
subject   : Subject: THE BURDEN OF UNBELIEF (3-12-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 11 Mar 2021 16:40:30 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Who has believed our message and to whom has **the arm of the Lord been
revealed? *

(Isa. 53:1) read: (Isa. 53:1-12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Christ suffered especially on Good Friday when people rejected His message.
Every

step of the road to Calvary was paved with unbelief. He confessed before
the high priest and council that He was the Christ, the Son

of the Highest, and before Pilate He testified to the truth of His kingdom—but
no one would believe Him. For every Christian since, it comes down to this: *Do
we believe it?*

* God grant that we do!*

* Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks to Jesus for speaking the truth and **to His Holy Spirit for
leading you to believe it.*
original_reflection_text: Christ suffered especially on Good Friday when people rejected His message. Every step of the road to Calvary was paved with unbelief. He confessed before the high priest and council that He was the Christ, the Son of the Highest, and before Pilate He testified to the truth of His kingdom-but no one would believe Him. For every Christian since, it comes down to this: Do we believe it? God grant that we do!
original_verse_text: Who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, reflecting on the profound truth that Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ, was rejected and suffered for our sake. Though the world refused to believe in Him, we declare with unwavering faith that He is the Christ, the Son of the Highest, and the King of Your eternal kingdom. Grant us the grace to receive Him and the power of Your Spirit to proclaim His truth to all who will hear. May our lives be a testament to the transformative power of Your love. Amen.
reflection: Christ suffered especially on Good Friday when people rejected His message. Every step of the road to Calvary was paved with unbelief. He confessed before the high priest and council that He was the Christ, the Son of the Highest, and before Pilate He testified to the truth of His kingdom—but no one would believe Him. For every Christian since, it comes down to this: Do we believe it? God grant that we do!
subject: The Burden of Unbelief
verse_text: Who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?

original_content:
message_id: 17828cb1d75948af
subject   : Subject: GOD'S LOVE IS TOTAL (3-13-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 12 Mar 2021 17:35:03 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*May you have the power to understand, *

*as all** God’s people should, how wide, *

*how long, how **high, and how deep His *

*love really is. *(Eph. 3:18) (read Eph. 3:14-21)

*Today’s Reflection:*

We can draw strength for the power and

love that exceeds the pressure of all earthly affliction: God’s love for us
in Christ. We

can sing, “Oh the height of Jesus’ love,

higher than the heav’ns above, deeper than

the depth of sea, lasting to eternity!

Love that found me—wonderous thought—found me when I sought Him not.” This

truth is based on the testimony of one who

was found by Jesus, although he was not seeking Him. Paul knew firsthand
the dimensions of Christ’s love. He wrote

that we may try to grasp its dimensions,

but Christ’s love for us is beyond our comprehension. It is a love that
“surpasses knowledge” (Eph. 3:19). In Christ “We

have redemption through His blood, the

forgiveness of sins, in accordance with

the riches of God’s grace. (Eph. 1:7)

*Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks and praise to your Savior for *

*His **boundless love.*
original_reflection_text:
We can draw strength for the power and love that exceeds the pressure of all earthly affliction: God’s love for us in Christ. We can sing, “Oh the height of Jesus’ love, higher than the heav’ns above, deeper than the depth of sea, lasting to eternity!
Love that found me-wondrous thought-found me when I sought Him not.” This truth is based on the testimony of one who was found by Jesus, although he was not seeking Him. Paul knew firsthand the dimensions of Christ’s love. He wrote
that we may try to grasp its dimensions, but Christ’s love for us is beyond our comprehension. It is a love that “surpasses knowledge” (Ephesians 3:19). In Christ “We have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God’s grace. (Ephesians 1:7)
original_verse_text: May you have the power to understand,  as all God’s people should, how wide,  how long, how high, and how deep His  love really is.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of the boundless love of Christ that surpasses all understanding. Your love for us is higher than the heavens, deeper than the depths of the sea, and lasting for eternity. May we grasp the immeasurable dimensions of Your grace and the riches of redemption found in Your Son. We give thanks for the forgiveness of sins and the unfailing love that has found us, even when we did not seek You. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: We can draw strength for the power and love that exceeds the pressure of all earthly affliction: God’s love for us in Christ. We can sing, “Oh the height of Jesus’ love, higher than the heav’ns above, deeper than the depth of sea, lasting to eternity! Love that found me-wondrous thought-found me when I sought Him not.” This truth is based on the testimony of one who was found by Jesus, although he was not seeking Him. Paul knew firsthand the dimensions of Christ’s love. He wrote that we may try to grasp its dimensions, but Christ’s love for us is beyond our comprehension. It is a love that “surpasses knowledge” (Ephesians 3:19). In Christ “We have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God’s grace. (Ephesians 1:7)
subject: God's Love is Total
verse_text: May you have the power to understand,  as all God’s people should, how wide,  how long, how high, and how deep His  love really is.

original_content:
message_id: 1782dbe940b46453
subject   : Subject: SLAYING WITH THE TONGUE (3-14-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 13 Mar 2021 16:39:28 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Come, let’s attack him [Jeremiah] with our tongues** and pay no attention
to anything he says. *(Jer. 18:18) (read Mt. 26:6-16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Much more than Jerimiah, Jesus was the victim of character assassination.
Amid

lies and deceit, the King of kings was

betrayed into enemy hands.The assassin

did not use a sword to deliver Jesus to

His death. He attacked Jesus with the

tongue When he asked the authorities,

“What are you willing to give me if I

hand Him over to you?” (Mt. 26:15).

*In contrast, Christians “call on [Jesus] *

*in every** trouble, pray, praise, and give thanks.”*

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Much more than Jerimiah, Jesus was the victim of character assassination. Amid lies and deceit, the King of kings was betrayed into enemy hands.The assassin did not use a sword to deliver Jesus to
His death. He attacked Jesus with the tongue When he asked the authorities, “What are you willing to give me if I hand Him over to you?” (Matthew 26:15). In contrast, Christians “call on [Jesus] in every trouble, pray, praise, and give thanks.”
original_verse_text: Come, let’s attack him [Jeremiah] with our tongues and pay no attention to anything he says.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with heavy hearts, reflecting on the betrayal of Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. Just as Jeremiah faced character assassination, so too did Your beloved Son, who was handed over to His enemies through the deceitful words of one who sought to profit from his treachery. Yet, we know that even in the midst of such darkness, Your light shines brightly, and we are called to call upon You, to pray, to praise, and to give thanks. Grant us the courage and wisdom to stand firm in our faith, even when the world seeks to undermine and betray us. We trust in Your unfailing love and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: Much more than Jeremiah, Jesus was the victim of character assassination. Amid lies and deceit, the King of kings was betrayed into enemy hands. The assassin did not use a sword to deliver Jesus to His death. He attacked Jesus with the tongue when he asked the authorities, “What are you willing to give me if I hand Him over to you?” (Matthew 26:15). In contrast, Christians “call on [Jesus] in every trouble, pray, praise, and give thanks.”
subject: Slaying with the Tongue
verse_text: Come, let’s attack him [Jeremiah] with our tongues and pay no attention to anything he says.

original_content:
message_id: 178380a4f0e188f3
subject   : 
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 15 Mar 2021 17:38:23 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: ACHIEVING TONGUE CONTROL (3-16-21)*



*Today’s Verses:*

*Consider the fact that a great forest can be *

*set on fire by a** small spark. The tongue is *

*also a fire, a world of evil among** the parts *

*of the body. *(Jm. 3:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We have the example of Jesus, who guarded His tongue, especially during His
trial:

“When they hurled their insults at Him,

He did not retaliate: when He suffered, He made no threats” ( Pet. 2:23).
When the

truth was at stake, however, He readily testified before the Sanhedrin and
before

Pontius Pilate. The example of Jesus would

be of little benefit if we didn’t have the motivation and might to use our
tongues

aright. Thank God that the in Holy Spirit

gives us this desire through our faith in

Jesus’ redeeming merit.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Lord Jesus to make you willing *

*and able to speak **only the truth in all of *

*l**ife’s situations.*
original_reflection_text:
We have the example of Jesus, who guarded His tongue, especially during His trial: “When they hurled their insults at Him, He did not retaliate: when He suffered, He made no threats” ( Peter 2:23). When the truth was at stake, however, He readily testified before the Sanhedrin and before
Pontius Pilate. The example of Jesus would be of little benefit if we didn’t have the motivation and might to use our tongues aright. Thank God that the in Holy Spirit gives us this desire through our faith in Jesus’ redeeming merit.
original_verse_text: Consider the fact that a great forest can be  set on fire by a small spark. The tongue is  also a fire, a world of evil among the parts  of the body.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the example of Your Son, Jesus, who guarded His tongue and spoke the truth with wisdom and grace, even in the face of adversity. By the power of Your Holy Spirit, grant us the desire and the strength to use our words to honor You, to build up others, and to testify to Your redeeming love. May we ever be mindful of the power of the tongue, and may our speech be pleasing in Your sight. Amen.
reflection: We have the example of Jesus, who guarded His tongue, especially during His trial: “When they hurled their insults at Him, He did not retaliate; when He suffered, He made no threats” (1 Peter 2:23). When the truth was at stake, however, He readily testified before the Sanhedrin and before Pontius Pilate. The example of Jesus would be of little benefit if we didn't have the motivation and might to use our tongues aright. Thank God that the Holy Spirit gives us this desire through our faith in Jesus' redeeming merit.
subject: Achieving Tongue Control
verse_text: Consider the fact that a great forest can be  set on fire by a small spark. The tongue is  also a fire, a world of evil among the parts  of the body.

original_content:
message_id: 1783d47621daf871
subject   : Subject: FOOTSTEPS OF THE SERVANT (3-17-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 16 Mar 2021 18:03:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*[He] made Himself nothing, taking the *

*very nature of a servant. *(Phil. 2:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus is more than an example to us, He

is also our equipper. Through the Holy

Spirit, He gives us gifts and abilities to

fulfill God’s will. He made us recipients

of all God’s spiritual blessings: reconcil-

iation and peace, forgiveness and life

eternal. *And *as the beneficiaries of the fullness of divine grace, we are
deeply

moved. In Martin Luther’s words, *That *

*I may be his own** and live under Him in *

*His kingdom.**”*

* Pastor Sather*

*We should always give thanks for our salvation and that we will gladly be
His disciple and servant.*
original_reflection_text:
Jesus is more than an example to us, He is also our equipped.
Through the Holy Spirit, He gives us gifts and abilities to fulfill God’s will. He made us recipients of all God’s spiritual blessings: reconcile iation and peace, forgiveness and life eternal. And as the beneficiaries of the fullness of divine grace, we are deeply moved.
In Martin Luther’s words, That I may be his own and live under Him in His kingdom.”
original_verse_text:
[He]
made Himself nothing, taking the  very nature of a servant.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the bountiful spiritual blessings You have bestowed upon us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. We are in awe of Your grace, that You would choose us before the foundation of the world to be holy and blameless in Your sight. Lord, may we humbly receive the gifts and abilities You have equipped us with, that we may faithfully fulfill Your will and live under the reign of Your Son, our King. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Jesus is more than an example to us, He is also our equipment. Through the Holy Spirit, He gives us gifts and abilities to fulfill God's will. He made us recipients of all God's spiritual blessings: reconciliation and peace, forgiveness and life eternal. And as the beneficiaries of the fullness of divine grace, we are deeply moved. In Martin Luther's words, “That I may be His own and live under Him in His kingdom.”
subject: Footsteps of the Servant
verse_text:
[He]
made Himself nothing, taking the  very nature of a servant.

original_content:
message_id: 178425b0abd92489
subject   : Subject: NEW LIFE IN CHRIST: (3-18-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 17 Mar 2021 17:42:46 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The newness of life is from God, who brought us **back to Himself through
what Christ did. And God **has given us the task of reconciling people to
Him. *(2 Cor. 5:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God brings us back to Himself by blotting

out our sins. (read Eph. 2:13-18) When we trust in Christ, we are no longer
God’s enemies, or strangers or foreigners to Him.

Because we have been reconciled to God,

we have the privilege of encouraging others

to do the same, and thus we are among those who have “the task of
reconciling others to

Him.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us pray that we remain faithful ambassadors for **Christ.*
original_reflection_text:
God brings us back to Himself by blotting out our sins. (read Ephesians 2:13-18) When we trust in Christ, we are no longer God’s enemies, or strangers or foreigners to Him.
Because we have been reconciled to God, we have the privilege of encouraging others to do the same, and thus we are among those who have “the task of reconciling others to
Him.
original_verse_text: The newness of life is from God, who brought us back to Himself through what Christ did. And God has given us the task of reconciling people to Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, we have been reconciled to You. Once we were alienated from You, but now we are Your beloved children, welcomed into Your family. Fill us with Your Spirit, that we may faithfully carry out the ministry of reconciliation, pointing others to the hope found in Christ. May Your love and grace transform our hearts, that we may be ambassadors of Your peace and redemption. Amen.
reflection: God brings us back to Himself by blotting out our sins. (Read Ephesians 2:13-18) When we trust in Christ, we are no longer God's enemies or strangers or foreigners to Him. Because we have been reconciled to God, we have the privilege of encouraging others to do the same, and thus we are among those who have “the task of reconciling others to Him.”
subject: New Life in Christ
verse_text: The newness of life is from God, who brought us back to Himself through what Christ did. And God has given us the task of reconciling people to Him.

original_content:
message_id: 17847431df6c973d
subject   : Subject: GOD WATCHES OVER US (3-19-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 18 Mar 2021 16:34:44 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The lord will watch over your coming and going both **now and forever. *(Ps.
121:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Whatever the situation in which God’s

people find themselves, one thing is sure:

God is with them and remembers them.

Psalm 121 is a beautiful reminder of

God’s promise to watch over us.---Our

divine Maker and Preserver is also our Redeemer in Christ Jesus, our
Savior.

God sent His beloved Son into the world

to redeem all its inhabitants from sin and

the fear of death. He also redeemed them

for something---for a purposeful life here

and now and for eternal life. So when we

see the song birds leave and other changes

each fall, we can be assured of God’s unchanging love for us and His
constant presence with us.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us remember to pray the lines of the hymn “Abide **with Me.”*
original_reflection_text:
Whatever the situation in which God’s people find themselves, one thing is sure: God is with them and remembers them. Psalm 121 is a beautiful reminder of God’s promise to watch over us.---Our divine Maker and Preserver is also our Redeemer in Christ Jesus, our Savior. God sent His beloved Son into the world to redeem all its inhabitants from sin and the fear of death. He also redeemed them for something---for a purposeful life here and now and for eternal life. So when we see the song birds leave and other changes
each fall, we can be assured of God’s unchanging love for us and His constant presence with us.
original_verse_text: The lord will watch over your coming and going both now and forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your constant presence and unfailing love. As the seasons change and life's circumstances shift, we find comfort in the truth that You are our ever-present Keeper, watching over us day and night. Strengthen our faith, that we may boldly declare, “The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid” (Hebrews 13:6). May Your blessing be upon us, now and forevermore. Amen.
reflection: Whatever the situation in which God’s people find themselves, one thing is sure: God is with them and remembers them. Psalm 121 is a beautiful reminder of God’s promise to watch over us.---Our divine Maker and Preserver is also our Redeemer in Christ Jesus, our Savior. God sent His beloved Son into the world to redeem all its inhabitants from sin and the fear of death. He also redeemed them for something---for a purposeful life here and now and for eternal life. So when we see the song birds leave and other changes each fall, we can be assured of God’s unchanging love for us and His constant presence with us.
subject: God Watches over Us
verse_text: The lord will watch over your coming and going both now and forever.

original_content:
message_id: 1784c9b67829ac73
subject   : Subject: BELIEVERS OUGHT TO BE LIVING EXAMPLES
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 19 Mar 2021 17:29:16 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(3-20-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Whoever turns a sinner from the error of *

*his way **will save him from death and over *

*a multitude of** sins. *(Jm. 5:20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The book of James emphasizes faith in

action. Right living is the evidence and

result of faith.The church must serve with compassion, speak lovingly and
truthfully,

live in obedience to God’s commands and

love one another. The body of believers

ought to be an example of heaven on earth,

drawing people to Christ through love for

God and each other. If we truly love God’s Word, we will live it day by
day. God’s

Word is not merely something we read or think about, but something we
do. *Belief,
faith,* *and trust must **have hands and *

*feet—ours!*

* Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks to God for every sinner who repents **and believes in Jesus as
Savior.*
original_reflection_text:
The book of James emphasizes faith in action. Right living is the evidence and result of faith.The church must serve with compassion, speak lovingly and truthfully, live in obedience to God’s commands and love one another. The body of believers ought to be an example of heaven on earth, drawing people to Christ through love for
God and each other. If we truly love God’s Word, we will live it day by day. God’s Word is not merely something we read or think about, but something we do. Belief, faith, and trust must have hands and feet-ours!
original_subject: BELIEVERS OUGHT TO BE LIVING EXAMPLES
original_verse_text: Whoever turns a sinner from the error of  his way will save him from death and over  a multitude of sins.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of Your Word and the call to live it out in our daily lives. Help us to be a light to the world, shining brightly with the love and compassion of Christ. May our faith be evident in our actions, as we seek to serve others and draw them closer to You. Guide us to speak truth with love, and to walk in obedience to Your commands. Lord, may our lives be a living testament to Your goodness and grace. Amen.
reflection: The book of James emphasizes faith in action. Right living is the evidence and result of faith.The church must serve with compassion, speak lovingly and truthfully, live in obedience to God’s commands and love one another. The body of believers ought to be an example of heaven on earth, drawing people to Christ through love for God and each other. If we truly love God’s Word, we will live it day by day. God’s Word is not merely something we read or think about, but something we do. Belief, faith, and trust must have hands and feet-ours!
subject: Believers Ought to be Living Examples
verse_text: Whoever turns a sinner from the error of  his way will save him from death and over  a multitude of sins.

original_content:
message_id: 17851ec1705263b6
subject   : Subject: A CHANGE OF VOCATION (3-21-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 20 Mar 2021 18:15:30 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Come, follow me,”* *Jesus said, “and I will make you ** fishers of
men.” *(Mk.
1:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

While some are wishing for the church to somehow grow, others are preparing
themselves to be instruments of God in

church growth as “fishers of men”

(Mk. 1:17)

Some Christians in our time feel called

to leave what they are doing—to quit

their day jobs—so they can concentrate

all their energies on missions They become full time fishers of people. But
it is not the Lord’s will that we all do this. Some of

Christ’s disciples continue in their roles

as fishermen, farmers, mechanics, business executives, teachers, nurses,
secretaries, and housewives. In so doing, we fulfill the over-

all Christian vocation of being Christ’s witnesses wherever we live and
work.

*Pastor Sather*

*Pray that Christian missionaries through-*

*out the **world may win many souls for *

*Christ, the world’s **Savior.*
original_reflection_text:
While some are wishing for the church to somehow grow, others are preparing themselves to be instruments of God in church growth as “fishers of men” (Mark 1:17)
Some Christians in our time feel called to leave what they are doing-to quit their day jobs-so they can concentrate all their energies on missions They become full time fishers of people. But it is not the Lord’s will that we all do this. Some of Christ’s disciples continue in their roles as fishermen, farmers, mechanics, business executives, teachers, nurses, secretaries, and housewives.
In so doing, we fulfill the over all Christian vocation of being Christ’s witnesses wherever we live and work.
original_verse_text: "Come, follow me," Jesus said, "and I will make you fishers of men."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the call to be “fishers of men” (Mark 1:17), to be Your instruments in growing Your church. Help us to faithfully fulfill the roles You have placed us in, whether as full-time ministers or as witnesses in our daily lives and work. May we shine the light of Your truth and love before others, that they may see our good deeds and glorify You (Matthew 5:14-16). Guide us, Lord, to be faithful and effective in our callings. Amen.
reflection: While some are wishing for the church to somehow grow, others are preparing themselves to be instruments of God in church growth as “fishers of men” (Mark 1:17) Some Christians in our time feel called to leave what they are doing-to quit their day jobs-so they can concentrate all their energies on missions They become full time fishers of people. But it is not the Lord’s will that we all do this. Some of Christ’s disciples continue in their roles as fishermen, farmers, mechanics, business executives, teachers, nurses, secretaries, and housewives. In so doing, we fulfill the over all Christian vocation of being Christ’s witnesses wherever we live and work.
subject: A Change of Vocation
verse_text: “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will make you fishers of men.”

original_content:
message_id: 1785bf0391a91790
subject   : Subject: SPIRITUA;L RICHES (3-24-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 22 Mar 2021 16:56:13 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Blessed are you who are poor, for yours *

*is the **kingdom of God.” *(Lk. 6:20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our Lord was saying, in effect, that spirit-

ual poverty brings great riches: the king-

dom of God. Spiritual poverty means hav-

ing no great works to show, no high stand-

ing, no merit of which to boast. It is, how-

ever, a poverty that is rich in faith that looks

to Jesus Christ for salvation, which is repent-ance and its fruits. In the
temple the boasting Pharisee was a spiritual pauper, but the pub-lican, who
said, “God, have mercy on me, a sinner” (Lk. 18:13) was spiritually rich.
He “went home justified by God” (Lk. 18:14).

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Holy Spirit that you may be enrich-*

*ed in all spiritual** treasures: forgiveness, the fruit of the Spirit, the
promise of **eternal life.*
original_reflection_text:
Our Lord was saying, in effect, that spirit ual poverty brings great riches: the king dom of God. Spiritual poverty means hav ing no great works to show, no high stand ing, no merit of which to boast. It is, how ever, a poverty that is rich in faith that looks to Jesus Christ for salvation, which is repentance and its fruits.
In the temple the boasting Pharisee was a spiritual pauper, but the publican, who said, “God, have mercy on me, a sinner” (Luke 18:13) was spiritually rich. He “went home justified by God” (Luke 18:14).
original_verse_text: Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You in humble recognition of our spiritual poverty. We acknowledge that we have no great works or merits to boast of, but only our faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ, who is the source of our salvation. Help us to cultivate a spirit of repentance and a deep dependence on Your grace, that we may be rich in the kingdom of God. May our hearts be like the publican, who cried out for Your mercy and found justification in Your sight. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: Our Lord was saying, in effect, that spirit ual poverty brings great riches: the king dom of God. Spiritual poverty means hav ing no great works to show, no high stand ing, no merit of which to boast. It is, how ever, a poverty that is rich in faith that looks to Jesus Christ for salvation, which is repentance and its fruits. In the temple the boasting Pharisee was a spiritual pauper, but the publican, who said, “God, have mercy on me, a sinner” (Luke 18:13) was spiritually rich. He “went home justified by God” (Luke 18:14).
subject: Spiritual Riches
verse_text: Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the kingdom of God.

original_content:
message_id: 17860fd7bfdbdbea
subject   : Subject: CHRIST'S MESSENGERS ON THE MOVE (3:25-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 23 Mar 2021 16:28:48 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Go into all the world and preach the *

*Good News **to all creation.” *(Mk. 16:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Nothing has changed. The Lord Jesus still sends His messengers into the
world. Their mission has not changed. They are to tell everyone that
Christ Jesus
came into the

world to save sinners from sin, death, and

the power of the devil. We are all participants in the church’s mission. No
rain, snow, nor

gloom of night can keep us from completing our appointed assignment.

*Pastor Sather*

*Pray that the Lord Jesus will continue to send many **messengers of God’s
saving *

*grace into the world.*
original_reflection_text:
Nothing has changed. The Lord Jesus still sends His messengers into the world. Their mission has not changed. They are to tell everyone that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners from sin, death, and the power of the devil. We are all participants in the church’s mission. No rain, snow, nor
gloom of night can keep us from completing our appointed assignment.
original_verse_text: Go into all the world and preach the  Good News to all creation.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the great commission You have entrusted to Your Church. May we, Your faithful servants, boldly proclaim the good news of salvation through Jesus Christ to all people, regardless of the obstacles we may face. Grant us courage, wisdom, and the power of Your Holy Spirit to fulfill our appointed task of making disciples of all nations. May our lives reflect the transformative love of Christ, drawing others to the hope found in Him. We are honored to participate in Your eternal plan of redemption. Amen.
reflection: Nothing has changed. The Lord Jesus still sends His messengers into the world. Their mission has not changed. They are to tell everyone that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners from sin, death, and the power of the devil. We are all participants in the church's mission. No rain, snow, nor gloom of night can keep us from completing our appointed assignment.
subject: Christ's Messengers on the Move
verse_text: Go into all the world and preach the  Good News to all creation.

original_content:
message_id: 1786662946957554
subject   : 
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 24 Mar 2021 17:37:20 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: THE PRACTICE OF CONTIN-UAL** PRAYER *(3-26-21)



*Today’s Verses:*

*Be joyful always, pray continually, give *

*thanks in **all circumstances. For this is *

*God’s will for you in** Christ Jesus. *

(I Thess. 5:16-18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The habit of diligent prayer prepares

us for times of trouble when prayer is especially needed. How sad the
situation

of King Saul when, filled with fear of the

large Philistine army, “he inquired of the

Lord, but the Lord did not answer him”

(I Sam. 28:6). It was *too late*. His unbelief

and neglect of prayer took their toll.

*Pastor Sather:*

*Ask the Lord to grant you His Holy Spirit so *

*you may** be enabled to pray faithfully in *

*Jesus’ name.*
original_reflection_text: The habit of diligent prayer prepares us for times of trouble when prayer is especially needed. How sad the situation of King Saul when, filled with fear of the large Philistine army, “he inquired of the Lord, but the Lord did not answer him” (I Samuel 28:6). It was too late. His unbelief and neglect of prayer took their toll.
original_verse_text: Be joyful always, pray continually, give  thanks in all circumstances. For this is  God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your sovereignty and the power of prayer. Teach us to rejoice always, pray without ceasing, and give thanks in all circumstances, for this is Your will for us in Christ Jesus. When fear and anxiety threaten to overwhelm us, may we cast our cares upon You, trusting that Your peace, which surpasses all understanding, will guard our hearts and minds. Help us to cultivate a life of constant communion with You, that we may be ready to seek Your face in times of need. We pray this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: The habit of diligent prayer prepares us for times of trouble when prayer is especially needed. How sad the situation of King Saul when, filled with fear of the large Philistine army, “he inquired of the Lord, but the Lord did not answer him” (1 Samuel 28:6). It was too late. His unbelief and neglect of prayer took their toll.
subject: The Practice of Continual Prayer
verse_text: Be joyful always, pray continually, give  thanks in all circumstances. For this is  God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.

original_content:
message_id: 1786b78c9c39f810
subject   : Subject: HEALING WATER (3-27-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 25 Mar 2021 17:19:41 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(read Titus 3:3-8)

*Today’s Verse:*

*[God] saved us through the washing of *

*rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit*.

(Titus 3:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our Lord Jesus used water for spiritual

healing when He instituted the Sacrament

of Baptism. The Word and the waters of Baptism heal spiritually *because*
the Holy Spirit works through it. It causes a sinner, *even* a very young
one, to come to saving faith. In Baptism, the water and the Word

flow like a refresh-ing, healing spring,

bringing with it all that our Savior earned

for us on the cross: forgiveness of sins, life, salvation, and spiritual
renewal.

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us give thanks to the Triune God, into whose name we were baptized,
for making *

*us one of His beloved children. *
original_reflection_text:
Our Lord Jesus used water for spiritual healing when He instituted the Sacrament of Baptism. The Word and the waters of Baptism heal spiritually because the Holy Spirit works through it. It causes a sinner, even a very young one, to come to saving faith. In Baptism, the water and the Word flow like a refreshing, healing spring, bringing with it all that our Savior earned for us on the cross:
forgiveness of sins, life, salvation, and spiritual renewal.
original_verse_text:
[God]
saved us through the washing of  rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the gift of Baptism, where the waters of cleansing and the power of Your Word bring spiritual healing and new life. Through this holy Sacrament, the Holy Spirit works to create faith in our hearts, granting us forgiveness, salvation, and the promise of eternal life. May we ever cherish the blessings of Baptism and walk in the newness of life it provides. Amen.
reflection: Our Lord Jesus used water for spiritual healing when He instituted the Sacrament of Baptism. The Word and the waters of Baptism heal spiritually because the Holy Spirit works through them. It causes a sinner, even a very young one, to come to saving faith. In Baptism, the water and the Word flow like a refreshing, healing spring, bringing with them all that our Savior earned for us on the cross: forgiveness of sins, life, salvation, and spiritual renewal.
subject: Healing Water
verse_text:
[God]
saved us through the washing of  rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit.

original_content:
message_id: 17875b64490c090b
subject   : Subject: ONLY ONE PATH TO THE FATHER (3-28-29)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 27 Mar 2021 17:03:03 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

Jesus told them, "*I am the way, the truth, *

*and the **life. No one can come to the Father except **through Me. *(Jn.
14:6)

(read Jn. 14:6-14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

As the *way**,* Jesus is our path to the Father.

As the *truth,* He is the reality of all God promises. As the *life,* He
joins His divine

life to ours, both now and eternally.

* Pastor Sather*

*When we pray let us not use God’s name *

*as a** magic formula to fulfill our selfish desires.*
original_reflection_text: As the way , Jesus is our path to the Father. As the truth, He is the reality of all God promises. As the life , He joins His divine life to ours, both now and eternally.
original_subject: ONLY ONE PATH TO THE FATHER
original_verse_text: Jesus told them, "I am the way, the truth,  and the life. No one can come to the Father except through Me.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You have revealed Yourself to us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. He is the way, the truth, and the life, the perfect embodiment of Your love and grace. May we cling to Him as our guide, our hope, and the source of our eternal life. Help us to walk in His footsteps and live according to Your will. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: As the way, Jesus is our path to the Father. As the truth, He is the reality of all God promises. As the life, He joins His divine life to ours, both now and eternally.
subject: Only One Path to the Father
verse_text: Jesus told them, “I am the way, the truth,  and the life. No one can come to the Father except through Me.

original_content:
message_id: 1787ac3540cd49b8
subject   : Subject: GOD'S DEED IN OUR BEHALF (3-29-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 28 Mar 2021 16:35:25 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*read Num. 23:13-26*



*Today’s Verse:*

*It will be said of Jacob and of Israel, *

*“See what **God has done!” *(Num. 23:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*“What God hath done” *has special meaning

in our lives. His great deeds for our salvation are crowned with His Son,
Jesus Christ, who lived a life of obedience for us, died for us, and rose from
the dead for us as foretold. From the Father and the Son come the Holy
Spirit to found the church and make us members of it by giving us saving
faith.

*One divine promise remains*:

Christ’s return in glory to take us home to

the Father in Heaven.

*Pastor Sather*

*Give thanks to God for having worked *

*the **wonders of His grace for our salva-*

*tion in **Christ Jesus.*
original_reflection_text:
“What God hath done” has special meaning in our lives. His great deeds for our salvation are crowned with His Son, Jesus Christ, who lived a life of obedience for us, died for us, and rose from the dead for us as foretold. From the Father and the Son come the Holy Spirit to found the church and make us members of it by giving us saving faith. One divine promise remains:
Christ’s return in glory to take us home to the Father in Heaven.
original_verse_text: It will be said of Jacob and of Israel, "See what GGGod has done!"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the great deeds You have done for our salvation. You sent Your Son, Jesus Christ, to live, die, and rise again, fulfilling Your promises and securing our eternal life. By the power of Your Holy Spirit, You have called us into Your Church and granted us saving faith. We eagerly await the day when Christ returns in glory to take us home to You. In Your great love and mercy, keep us steadfast in this hope. Amen.
reflection: “What God has done” has special meaning in our lives. His great deeds for our salvation are crowned with His Son, Jesus Christ, who lived a life of obedience for us, died for us, and rose from the dead for us as foretold. From the Father and the Son comes the Holy Spirit to found the church and make us members of it by giving us saving faith. One divine promise remains: Christ's return in glory to take us home to the Father in Heaven.
subject: God's Deed in Our Behalf
verse_text: It will be said of Jacob and of Israel, “See what GGGod has done!”

original_content:
message_id: 178802af1cac9127
subject   : Subject: THE MOTHER WHO STOOD HER GROUND (3-30-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 29 Mar 2021 17:46:41 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*read Jn. 19:25-27*



*Today’s Verse:*

*Near the cross of Jesus stood His mother.*

(Jn. 19:250



*Today’s Reflection:*

Yes there Mary stood watching her son

dying on the cross. How was this poss-

ible? It was because she had faith that

God would stand behind His promised

Christ. And so it is with us. We have our sorrows, but we can stand certain
in the promises of God.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask Jesus to turn your pains and sorrows into** joy because He lives.*
original_reflection_text: Yes there Mary stood watching her son dying on the cross. How was this poss ible? It was because she had faith that God would stand behind His promised Christ. And so it is with us. We have our sorrows, but we can stand certain in the promises of God.
original_subject: THE MOTHER WHO STOOD HER GROUND
original_verse_text: Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts full of sorrow, yet also with unwavering faith in Your promises. Like Mary, we witness the suffering of Your Son, but we trust that Your eternal plan will prevail. Grant us the strength to endure our trials, knowing that the glory to come will far outweigh our present pain. May our eyes remain fixed on the hope we have in Christ, who has overcome the world. Amen.
reflection: Yes, there Mary stood, watching her son dying on the cross. How was this possible? It was because she had faith that God would stand behind His promised Christ. And so it is with us. We have our sorrows, but we can stand certain in the promises of God.
subject: The Mother Who Stood Her Ground
verse_text: Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

original_content:
message_id: 17885401df20c583
subject   : Subject: GROWTH FROM SMALL BEGINNINGS (3-31-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 30 Mar 2021 17:27:55 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus told them another parable: “The kingdom of **heaven is like a
mustard seed.” *(Mt. 13:31) (read Mt. 13:31-35)



*Today’s Reflection:*

At first Christians were persecuted but by

the middle of the fourth century A.D., the Roman emperor, Constantine the
First, professed the Christian faith.Through the

centuries God has continued to lead

many people into His church. Thus there

has been great growth in the Christian

church from a very small beginning.

*Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Holy Spirit to grant His blessings *

*on the** preaching of Christ’s Gospel *

*throughout the **world.*
original_reflection_text: At first Christians were persecuted but by the middle of the fourth century A.D., the Roman emperor, Constantine the First, professed the Christian faith.Through the centuries God has continued to lead many people into His church. Thus there has been great growth in the Christian church from a very small beginning.
original_verse_text: Jesus told them another parable: "The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your faithfulness in growing Your church from a small beginning. Just as the mustard seed grows into a large tree, may Your kingdom continue to expand and flourish, reaching all nations with the good news of salvation. Empower us, Your people, to faithfully proclaim the gospel and make disciples, that Your name may be exalted throughout the earth. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: At first, Christians were persecuted, but by the middle of the fourth century A.D., the Roman emperor, Constantine the First, professed the Christian faith. Through the centuries, God has continued to lead many people into His church. Thus, there has been great growth in the Christian church from a very small beginning.
subject: Growth from Small Beginnings
verse_text: Jesus told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed.”

original_content:
message_id: 1788a32894323d65
subject   : Subject: JESUS IS PRESENT (4-1-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 31 Mar 2021 16:31:11 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
Maundy Thursday



*Today’s Verse:*

*Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a **participation
in the blood of Christ? And **is not the bread **that we break *

*a participation in the body of Christ?*

(I Cor. 10:16) read (I Cor. 10:14-17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is a comfort to know as we gather at

the Lord’s Table that Jesus is there. His promise is: “Surely I am with you
always,

to the very end of the age” (Mt. 28:20).

*And* “where two or three come together

in My name, there I am with them” (Mt. 18:20). In addition, we have His
very

specific promise that He is with us in a

very special way when we attend Holy Communion.

*Pastor Sather*

* Before coming to the Lord's Table *

*[the altar] Let us always ask the Holy Spirit to *

*prepare our hearts **for receiving* *the Lord’s *

*body and blood.*
original_reflection_text: It is a comfort to know as we gather at the Lord’s Table that Jesus is there. His promise is: “Surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age” (Matthew 28:20). And “where two or three come together in My name, there I am with them” (Matthew 18:20). In addition, we have His very specific promise that He is with us in a very special way when we attend Holy Communion.
original_verse_text: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? And is not the bread that we break  a participation in the body of Christ?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the promise of Your presence as we gather at Your table. We rejoice that You are with us, Lord, when we come together in Your name, and that You draw near to us in a special way through the sacrament of Holy Communion. May we receive Your body and blood with grateful hearts, knowing that You are here to nourish and sustain us. We praise You, O God, for this precious gift. Amen.
reflection: It is a comfort to know as we gather at the Lord's Table that Jesus is there. His promise is: “Surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age” (Matthew 28:20). And “where two or three come together in My name, there I am with them” (Matthew 18:20). In addition, we have His very specific promise that He is with us in a very special way when we attend Holy Communion.
subject: Jesus is Present
verse_text: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? And is not the bread that we break  a participation in the body of Christ?
